column4: How do I remove the email icon from the indicator applet in the gnome panel? I dont care about email since I use gmail as a webapp.
right click it and select Remove
the applet consists of more then one icon
I want to keep the volume slider but ubuntu removed the old separate one in 10.10
now its one thing with email and volume and keyring etc
they should cut them up into one icon things so I can ditch the ones I dont like >:(
and since when is an icon inside the tray not good enough
dont need an applet for it
you can see my network has a tray icon, can I get one for volume aswell?
right click the panel, and click Add to panel
like i said ubuntu removed the one that was there for just volume with ubuntu 10.10
at least I have no volume app there.
